page.title: 02KING EDWARD VII HOSPITAL
page.content: Situated in 152 acres of its own grounds, King Edward VII Hospital was founded by H.M. King Edward VII in 1902 to provide treatment for "professional people of lesser means" suffering from tuberculosis. In the 1950's, when this need was diminished, facilities for general medical care were developed and the hospital now provides accommodation for 182 medical and surgical patients with four operating theatres and 24-hour service of{pathology, radiograpy, pharmacy}and {physiotherapy,}staffed by full-time personnel. Incorporated by Royal Charter, it is the only hospital in England of which HM Queen Elizabeth II is the President and all major appointments must be approved by her. It is a registered charity which has allocated a proportion of its beds for National Health Service patients.
